workflow.name: Article to threaded Bluesky posts with JinaAI and Gemini/GPT
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

### Who is this for?

Automation enthusiasts, content creators, or social media managers who post article-based threads to Bluesky and want to automate the process end-to-end.

### What problem is this solving?

Manual content repackaging and posting can be repetitive and time-consuming. This workflow automates the process from capturing article URLs (via Telegram or RSS) to scraping content, transforming it into a styled thread, and posting on Bluesky platform.

### What this workflow does

* Listens on **Telegram** or fetches from **RSS feeds** (AI Trends, Machine Learning Mastery, Technology Review).
* Extracts content from URLs using **JinaAI**.
* Converts the article into a neat, scroll-stopping thread via **LangChain + Gemini / OpenAI ChatGPT**.
* Splits the thread into multiple posts. The first post is published with ‚ÄúCreate a Post‚Äù, while subsequent posts are replies.
* Adds short delays between posting to avoid rate limits.

### Setup

1. Add credentials for **Telegram Bot API**, **JinaAI**, **Google Gemini**, and **Bluesky App Password**.
2. Add or customize RSS feeds if needed 
3. Test with a sample URL to validate posting sequence.

### How to customize

* Swap out RSS feeds or trigger sources.
* Modify prompt templates or thread formatting rules in the LangChain/Gemini node.
* Adjust wait times or content parsing logic.
* Replace Bluesky with another posting target if desired.


Made by: **[Khaisa Studio](https://khaisa.studio?utm_source=n8nofficial)**
Need customs workflows? **[Contact Me!](https://khmuhtadin/contact)**

messageValues.message:
=You are a social media strategist crafting high-performing Threads posts.
Your mission: take the input content and turn it into a captivating, scroll-stopping Threads thread. Follow these principles:

1. Hook Like a Pro
Open with a post that makes people stop scrolling‚Äîcreate intrigue without lying.

Use curiosity-driven hooks such as:

"This changes everything about‚Ä¶"

"Most people don‚Äôt realize that‚Ä¶"

A bold but truthful statement.

Pose questions or statements that leave a knowledge gap people want to fill.

Keep it authentic‚Äînever trick your audience.

2. Make It Flow
Break the content into short, clear, and connected posts.

Every post should push the reader to the next one.

Keep language simple and conversational (unless technical accuracy is critical).

3. Engage Without Overdoing It
Use humor lightly‚Äîonly if it fits naturally.

Avoid emojis unless they genuinely enhance the point.

Keep the core message intact while optimizing for retention and shareability.

4. Exact Output Rules
Format:
Never use a dash or em dash, consider substituting it with other punctuation like commas or rephrase the sentence to eliminate the interruption entirely

Wrap the entire thread in [THREADSTART] and [THREADEND].

Separate each post with -cutthread-.
A post is maximum of 300 character


Example:

[THREADSTART]
First post content here
-cutthread-
Second post content here
-cutthread-
Third post content here
-cutthread-
lastpost must be:
"Read more on: {{ $('Prepare Input URL').item.json.inputUrl }}

Get AI automation to make life easier on https://khaisa.studio"
[THREADEND]



Output only the transformed thread. No greetings, explanations, or meta-notes.

parameters.content:
## üìå How to Get Credentials

- **Telegram Bot** ‚Üí Create a bot via [@BotFather](https://t.me/botfather), copy the *API Token*.  
- **JinaAI** ‚Üí Sign up at [jina.ai](https://jina.ai), get your *API Key* from the dashboard.  
- **Google Gemini** ‚Üí Enable the API at [Google AI Studio](https://makersuite.google.com/), generate an *API Key*.  
- **Bluesky** ‚Üí Log in at [Bluesky](https://bsky.app), create an *App Password* in settings.

## Error Handling

- If JinaAI fails ‚Üí check URL is valid & accessible.  
- If Gemini times out ‚Üí reduce prompt size or simplify input.  
- If Bluesky rejects post ‚Üí check App Password validity or rate limits.  
- Always test with a small sample before running full automation.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
